Seed.Tag1: Preparationh r h h r h h r h oh 3 ][ [ ]n ch2oh alpha-amyrin fatty acid ester, r = ch3(ch2)ncoo alpha-amyrin acetate, r = oac ursenone, r = o oleanone, r = o oac2b r = ch3(ch2)ncoo beta-amyrin fatty acid ester, r = lupenone, r = o oac3b r = ch3(ch2)ncoo lupeol fatty acid ester, r = squalene, polyprenol, phytol, oh ho beta-carotene, lutein, hh ho h stigmasterol, 10 h ho h h isolation the dichloromethane extract of the air-dried leaves of ficus pseudopalma (1 stigmasterol, kg) was chromatographed on a silica gel column using increasing proportions of acetone in dichloromethane at 10% increment.

Relation.Pattern: a decoction of the leaves is used for the treatment of kidney stones and diabetes, while the young shoots are eaten as vegetables (stuart 2008).

philippine journal of science 138 : 205-209, december 2009 issn 0031 7683 key words: carotenoids, ficus pseudopalma, ficus ulmifolia, moreaceae, phytol, polyprenol, sterols, triterpenes *corresponding author: ragasa@dlsu.edu.ph 205 terpenoids and sterols from the endemic and endangered philippine trees, ficus pseudopalma and ficus ulmifolia consolacion y. ragasa,1,* po-wei tsai, and chien-chang shen 1chemistry department, de la salle university, 2401 taft avenue, manila 1004, philippines and center for natural sciences and ecological research, de la salle university 2401 taft avenue, 1004 manila 2national research institute of chinese medicine, 155-1, li-nong st., sec 2, taipei 112, taiwan the dichloromethane extract of the air-dried leaves of the endemic and endangered philippine trees.
the dichloromethane extract of the air-dried leaves of ficus ulmifolia (742 g) was chromatographed on a silica gel column using increasing proportions of acetone in dichloromethane at 10% increment.
